summary: This bill, the Workplace Violence Prevention for Health Care and Social Service Workers Act (H.R. 2531), mandates the Secretary of Labor to establish an occupational safety and health standard requiring healthcare and social service employers to develop and implement comprehensive workplace violence prevention plans. These plans must include risk assessments, hazard controls, training, and recordkeeping. The bill specifies the standard's scope, application, and effective dates, and it amends the Social Security Act to ensure compliance in facilities receiving Medicare funds. The bill aims to protect healthcare and social service workers from workplace violence.
